subject: Productivity
title: The Paradox of Choice
description: A fast breakdown of The Paradox of Choice for builders.

hook.text: A grocery store offered 24 jams for tasting. Another offered 6. The smaller display sold ten times more.

buildup.text: Barry Schwartz described the paradox of choice: more options lead to worse decisions and less satisfaction.

discovery.text: When overwhelmed by options, people either choose nothing or choose poorly. Narrowing options improves outcomes.

twist.text: The modern knowledge worker faces hundreds of micro-decisions daily. Without prioritization, they drown in choices.

climax.text: Prioritization isn't about doing more. It's about deciding what not to do so the rest gets done well.

punchline.text: Fewer choices, better outcomes. Prioritize ruthlessly.

quiz.question: What happened when shoppers were offered 24 jam options versus 6?
options: The smaller display sold ten times more
